data.title: 20 Top Universities in the Philippines
data.meta_description: We've compiled a list of the top 20 universities in the Philippines. It's based on academic reputation, and overall student satisfaction
data.text:
With over 2,300 universities, picking the best college in the Philippines is challenging.

We have compiled a list of 20 universities to make work easier for students joining college. Moreover, we have weighed up the option of studying online at a college like UoPeople.

Read along to choose one university that matches your expectations in higher education.

1. University of the Philippines Diliman

The University of the Philippines (UP) is the Philippines’ National university.

It offers undergraduate and graduate programs. At UP, students can study business, engineering, law, and the arts.

UP has several research centers supporting students doing various research projects.

2. Ateneo de Manila University

Ateneo de Manila University offers business, law, engineering, and arts programs.

It also provides commerce, governance, medicine, and social sciences programs. People honor ADMU for its strong stress on research and humanistic learning.

3. De La Salle University

De La Salle University ranks top on the Philippines colleges and universities list for its in-demand courses. The college offers business, engineering, education, and arts. Furthermore, DLSU offers computer studies, economics, and sciences programs.

4. University of Santo Tomas

The University of Santo Tomas is Asia’s most ancient private University.

Students honor the college’s rich history, Christian values, and marketable academic programs.

The college has 63 courses, including arts, business, law, and engineering.

5. Mapua University

Mapua University is regarded as a Center of Excellence in Civil Engineering by CHED.

Besides engineering, it offers programs in engineering, architecture, and business.

The university has 15 internationally accredited programs.

6. Far Eastern University

Far Eastern University (FEU) has multiple academic programs for undergraduate and postgraduate students. Its top courses are business, health sciences, engineering, and education. It has a status for training competitive graduates appreciated for excellence and uprightness.

7. Polytechnic University of the Philippines

The Polytechnic University of the Philippines is known for one main thing. It offers professional instruction to produce self-reliant, creative, and productive graduates. It provides administration, computer science, social sciences, and tourism programs.

8. University of San Carlos

The University Of San Carlos takes a slot among the top 20 universities in the Philippines for its mission of creating proficient graduates.

It produces socially responsible graduates who are well-prepared to impact society positively.

The college offers arts, architecture, healthcare, business, law, and governance programs.

9. Technological Institute of the Philippines

TIP is a premier institution with internationally competitive courses. It offers engineering programs that are accredited by the US-based ABET.

Additionally, TIP provides business, IT, maritime studies, arts, and education programs.

10. University of the East

The University of the East collaborates with several research centers to offer the best in class training. It provides engineering, business, computer science, education, and sciences.

It has trained over 1 million graduates who’ve made a mark in various sectors.

11. University of San Agustin

The University of San Agustin is one of the most distinguished universities in the country. It offers engineering, business, education, nursing, and the liberal arts.

It provides a holistic education emphasizing faith, service, and excellence.

12. Adamson University

Adamson University appears on the list of best colleges in the Philippines for its flagship engineering courses. It also offers business, education, nursing, and the liberal arts.

AU has strong partnerships with industry leaders, giving students experiential learning opportunities.

13. Central Luzon State University

Luzon State University offers business, social sciences, education, engineering, science, and medicine programs.

The prestigious college boasts a meticulous curriculum and distinguished faculty experts.

14. Silliman University

Silliman University is a center for global studies. It offers online and distance learning programs, letting students study from wherever.

It centers on agriculture, business administration, education, and computer studies. It also provides nursing, visual arts, laboratory services, and public affairs courses.

15. University of the Assumption (UA)

The University of the Assumption has a history of providing holistic education. It combines academic rigor with values-based learning to produce skilled graduates.

UA offers accountancy, engineering, education, and nursing. Furthermore, it provides tourism, pharmacy, and information technology.

16. University of Cebu

The University of Cebu ranks as one of the top universities in the Philippines for one reason. It runs by the no tuition fee increase policy, making it affordable.

It offers biological sciences, accountancy, education, administration, and social studies.

17. Western Mindanao State University

Western Mindanao State University has home economics, agriculture, forestry, and criminal justice programs. Moreover, the university offers sports science, law, engineering, and public administration programs. It partners with other research institutions to improve the quality of training.

18. University of San Jose Recoletos

USJ-R has a mission to provide the highest standards of higher education. Furthermore, the university brags about a diverse student body and commitment to social responsibility.

It offers arts, sciences, business, engineering, education, and nursing programs.

19. University of the Immaculate Conception

The University of the Immaculate Conception specializes in two things. It offers values-based learning and trains well-rounded graduates. The college provides business, engineering, education, and nursing academic programs.

20. Visayas State University

Visayas State University works with several research centers to improve the quality of training. Like other best colleges in the Philippines, Visayas offers multiple courses.

Its most popular programs are agriculture, forestry, engineering, and education.

Studying Online in an Accredited US-Based University

Studying abroad is a good alternative for students who miss a place in their favorite Philippines colleges and universities — however, moving to other countries has challenges. For instance, most universities are expensive, and finding a visa takes time.

That is where the University of the People comes in. We are a fully online college serving students across the world. Like any university, we have master’s, bachelor’s, associate’s, and certificate courses. Why us?

We Offer Accredited Programs

We have several academic programs, including health sciences, information technology, and education. We also offer business and computer science courses. The Distance Education Accrediting Commission certifies the programs.

We are Affordable

University of the People is tuition free. Our students pay a small application and assessment fee to study their preferred courses. We even have scholarship programs for students who need financial support.

We have an easy Application Process

Taking a program at our university is easy. We accept most students who make an application. You need to be above 16 years, complete high school, and be able to read and write in English.
